sub_title: Global Research & Development Packaging Category Specialist
summary:
● Experienced project manager with a perfect eye for detail. Able to get things done right and on time.
● Able to work on projects from start to finish. I inspire to deliver an positive project experience all the way to a successful launch.
● Excellent communication and organisational skills, working professionally with clients, stakeholders, project teams and suppliers. 
● Creative solutions for production and project management in both supply chain and print production.
● Motivated, energetic, knowledgeable and able to handle stressful situations.
● Positive attitude with a great sense of people skills, a big smile and a dedicated work ethic.
● Fluent in English and a Dutch speaker

certifications.name: NVC E-Workshop Sustainable Innovation in Packaging

projects.title: Spoorweg Museum, Sporen naar het Front

contributors.headline: Global Research & Development Packaging Category Specialist

profile_positions.title: Global Research & Development Packaging Category Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Within the Global R&D Packaging Sustainable Innovation team, The Packaging Innovation System Specialist is responsible for leading packaging innovation exploration. Defining packaging opportunities which are fit for purpose. Designing with sustainably in mind. Bringing ideas to life and ensuring we showcase our technologies in a impactful way.
Reduce, Reuse, Recycle, and Compostable packaging solutions to reduce our impact on a global scale.
profile_positions.title: Global Research & Development Packaging Innovation Systems Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Artwork Production Specialist, from design phase to print production.
Implementation lead for the digital artwork management and approval tool, SyncForce. 
Implementation lead for system compliance between SyncForce and PLM system, Hamilton Grant.
 
I have a strong knowledge of design, digital artwork management tools, printing technologies, reprographics and all artwork requirements and extensive experience in managing artwork at a FMCG company.
Working on multi projects with great management and organizational skills, while being able to zoom in on the details where needed.
My role is to connect with internal and external stakeholders and coordinate with the reprographics agency to resolve design and printing technical issues.
Manage the approval flow of all stakeholders to ensure the artworks are correctly approved and that the delivery of printed packaging materials are on time and within printing standards into the factory.
Ensuring brand guidelines, the colour quality and the design intended is followed for the best visual impact.
For me it is key to communicate and resolve issues with internal and external stakeholders at the start, to manage expectations to prioritise the workflow.
profile_positions.title: Design to Print Production Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Innovation implementation for the end to end supply chain. 
Management of all portfolio changes including innovations, sustainability, reallocation, technical changes and cost reductions.
Portfolio management and complexity reduction.
 
Responsibility for the end to end supply chain, with key accountability to ensure all plan, source, make and deliver activities are completed on time and in full.
Ensure all innovation implementations are planned to take into account the delivery of the key KPI’s of cost, service, stocks and Obsoletes.
Supporting the project team to ensure product launches are on time with no quality issues and all elements fall within our operational excellence.
Adhere and enforce Unilever business principles, sustainability guidelines and the threshold criteria. 
Responsibility for VIP projects, reallocation requests, regulatory changes and the move to more sustainably packaging requirements.
Work directly with marketing operations on all local country requests understand consumer behaviour for innovation and renovation projects and then be accountable for their approval and implementation.
Ownership of the category master data. Responsibility for all master data, code creation in SAP, maintenance, oversee the BOM creation and PLM. Able to collect complex data and translate into reports and summaries to present to the stakeholders.
Managing the portfolio and complexity reduction initiatives ensuring continuous improvement.
profile_positions.title: Portfolio and Innovations Planner, Supply Chain.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the coordination and management of the packaging artwork process.
 
Able to work from design lock through to the creation of mechanical artwork files ensuring they meet the requirements and deadlines.
Working with internal teams, such as Marketing, R&D, Supply Chain and Quality who provide the data and content, also working with our external partners, Repro and Design agencies, Printers, and 3nd party suppliers.
Responsible for initiating and managing projects within the Artwork Management System.
Providing technical advice and input in the design, artwork and print phase to ensure that brand quality and consistency is maintained through the artwork process and supplier printing process. 
Understand the category and brand guidelines and work towards the Unilever sustainability on packaging 2025 goal.
profile_positions.title: Artwork Production Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Managing projects, budgets and production requirements. 
 
Research, request quotes, booking and confirming of all external requirements.
Creating and overseeing budgets. Oversee the logistics and deadlines.
Working closely together with clients to ensure all parts of the project are up to company brand standards.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
I began my own project management and graphic design company on a freelance and contract bases.
 
Design and create packaging solutions for lifestyle and home goods. 
Concepts and design for packaging, posters, catalogues, flyers, logos and magazine adverts.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager and Graphic Design

profile_positions.description:
Custom trade show project manager. Coordinating the requirements from design to the construction build.
 
Liaise closely and meet regularly with clients, suppliers, designers and organisers. Negotiate best price rates with suppliers and trade discounts.
Communication with suppliers and create the design briefs.
Exhibition stands project management. Beginning with the development of the design, advising on stand construction methods including integrity, signage and graphics production, organising logistics.
Insuring a successful build/install and dismantle of the stand making it within deadlines and budget. Managing multiple projects at one time.
profile_positions.title: Estimator and Project Manager, Custom Build Division

profile_positions.description:
● The project management of exhibition stands and retail fit-out projects. 
● Researching, booking and organisation of all aspects of a project. 
● Create budgets, costing and quotes and making sure the project stays within the budget.
● Sourcing suitable suppliers, contractors, venues and labour. 
● Manage on site labour team, solving last minute problems. 
● Responsible for the delivery of projects to a tight deadline, whilst keeping a high standard and remain true to the design and client brand style
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Catalyst has a large international and national client base. Working on many marketing projects we looked after all of the clients requirements for trade shows, conferences and events. 

Responsibilities:
● Exhibition stands: Manage all aspects of the project both national and international. Beginning with the development of the design, advising on stand construction methods including integrity, signage and graphics production, organising logistics, travel and accommodation. Insuring a successful build/install and dismantle of the stand making it within deadlines and budget.
● Events: Liaise with clients, venues and suppliers to coordinate all aspects of the event including on site staff management. Booking labour, photographers, researching venues and locations.
● Print and Graphics production: Coordinating the organisation of graphics, artworks, signage, design materials and printed formats.
● Liaise closely and meet regularly with clients, suppliers, designers and organisers.
● Negotiate best price rates with suppliers and trade discounts. Research to get the best possible price.
● Write supplier and design briefs and manage multiple projects.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager and Coordinator
